title: Diff in reverse_query2.xml starting 01/03/2013 in 5.0 (Original bug 20484)
description:
Identified the change that caused this: 126280.  I had to run the following:
 
make tests tname=foo clean=yes
make ut tname=reverse_query2.xml

The failed tests are:
run reverse query against saved queries for docs 1 to 10
run reverse query against saved queries for docs 11 to 20
run reverse query against saved queries for docs 21 to 30

changeHistory.comment:

Tested Mary's patch and it fixed the issue.  So passing this on to Mary.
Bug:20600 proper fix for Bug:20011 and Bug:20398 and clones

Fixed 5.0-20130201

Various element-word cases involving 1/2/3 elements and 1/2/3 words alone, inside near queries, and inside and queries should be tried. Bugs 20011 and 20389 are also in this same area.

e.g.

cts:element-word-query((xs:QName("one"),xs:QName("two")), ("dog","cat"))

Mary, this test now passes on the sandbox build 5.0-20130131 10:05am. But do you think this fix could have some performance impact? Because, this test which used to complete in less than 6 minutes in an older build 5.0-20121207, now takes more than 15 minutes to complete. Can you please verify?

I don't really understand how reverse query handles this. But in the forwards case it will be doing more positions processing than it used to, to improve accuracy. So it may be that it was quick before, because it was wrong.

Per Mary's comment, I think it's ok for this test to run a little longer. So I'm going to move this bug to 'ship' and let the test be as-is in regression. But if we see that one particular test case in the test runs for more than 1/2 hour or so and hence triggers a sigAbrt, then we'll open a new bug and investigate.
